meanings.definition: An idea, feeling, or opinion about something or someone
meanings.sent1: Her first impression of the new teacher was that he was kind.
meanings.sent2: My impression is that the movie was exciting and fun.
meanings.sent3: I got the impression that the cat was trying to speak English!
meanings.sent4: The music left a lasting impression on my heart.
meanings.sent5: The impression of the sunset on the water was breathtaking.

meanings.definition: A mark or indentation made by pressure
meanings.sent1: The artist created an impression of a leaf on the clay.
meanings.sent2: The impression of the coin was left on the soft material.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally made an impression of my face on the pillow.
meanings.sent4: The impression of the shoe on the sand looked like a tiny footprint.
meanings.sent5: The impression of the key in the lock was still visible.

meanings.definition: A strong effect or influence on someone or something
meanings.sent1: The speech left a strong impression on the audience.
meanings.sent2: The impression of the storm was evident in the damaged trees.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow had a surprising impression on the dog.
meanings.sent4: His words made an impression on her heart, like a gentle breeze.
meanings.sent5: The impression of the mountain on the landscape was majestic.
